segment.source: Set up your UWP on Xbox development environment
segment.target: Set up your UWP on Xbox development environment

segment.source: Steps to set up and test your UWP on Xbox development environment.
segment.target: Steps to set up and test your UWP on Xbox development environment.

segment.source: Set up your UWP on Xbox development environment
segment.target: Set up your UWP on Xbox development environment

segment.source: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) on Xbox development environment consists of a development PC connected to an Xbox One console through a local network.
segment.target: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) on Xbox development environment consists of a development PC connected to an Xbox One console through a local network.

segment.source: The development PC requires Windows 10, Visual Studio 2015 Update 2, Windows 10 SDK preview build 14295, and a range of supporting tools.
segment.target: The development PC requires Windows 10, Visual Studio 2015 Update 2, Windows 10 SDK preview build 14295, and a range of supporting tools.

segment.source: This article covers the steps to set up and test your development environment.
segment.target: This article covers the steps to set up and test your development environment.

segment.source: Visual Studio setup
segment.target: Visual Studio setup

segment.source: Install Visual Studio 2015 Update 2 or later.
segment.target: Install Visual Studio 2015 Update 2 or later.

segment.source: For more information and to install, see Downloads and tools for Windows 10.
segment.target: For more information and to install, see Downloads and tools for Windows 10.

segment.source: When installing Visual Studio 2015 Update 2, ensure that the Universal Windows App Development Tools check box is selected.
segment.target: When installing Visual Studio 2015 Update 2, ensure that the Universal Windows App Development Tools check box is selected.

segment.source: Install Visual Studio 2015 Update 2
segment.target: Install Visual Studio 2015 Update 2

segment.source: Windows 10 SDK setup
segment.target: Windows 10 SDK setup

segment.source: Install the latest Windows 10 SDK preview build.
segment.target: Install the latest Windows 10 SDK preview build.

segment.source: For installation information, see Download Insider Preview updates for developers.
segment.target: For installation information, see Download Insider Preview updates for developers.

segment.source: Important You need to install the latest SDK, but you do not need to install the latest Windows Insider Preview release of the operating system.
segment.target: Important You need to install the latest SDK, but you do not need to install the latest Windows Insider Preview release of the operating system.

segment.source: Create your first application
segment.target: Create your first application

segment.source: Make sure your development PC is on the same local network as the target Xbox One console.
segment.target: Make sure your development PC is on the same local network as the target Xbox One console.

segment.source: Typically, this means they should use the same router and be on the same subnet.
segment.target: Typically, this means they should use the same router and be on the same subnet.

segment.source: A wired network connection is recommended.
segment.target: A wired network connection is recommended.

segment.source: Ensure that your Xbox One console is in Developer Mode.
segment.target: Ensure that your Xbox One console is in Developer Mode.

segment.source: For more information, see Enabling Developer Mode on Xbox One.
segment.target: For more information, see Enabling Developer Mode on Xbox One.

segment.source: Decide the programming language you want to use for your UWP app.
segment.target: Decide the programming language you want to use for your UWP app.

segment.source: On your development PC, select New Project, and then select Windows / Universal / Blank App.
segment.target: On your development PC, select New Project, and then select Windows / Universal / Blank App.

segment.source: Starting a C# project
segment.target: Starting a C# project

segment.source: New Project dialog
segment.target: New Project dialog

segment.source: Select the default options in the New Universal Windows Project dialog.
segment.target: Select the default options in the New Universal Windows Project dialog.

segment.source: If the Developer Mode dialog appears, click OK.
segment.target: If the Developer Mode dialog appears, click OK.

segment.source: A new blank app is created.
segment.target: A new blank app is created.

segment.source: Configure your development environment for remote debugging:
segment.target: Configure your development environment for remote debugging:

segment.source: Right-click the project, and then select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the project, and then select Properties.

segment.source: On the Debug tab, change Target device to Remote Machine.
segment.target: On the Debug tab, change Target device to Remote Machine.

segment.source: In Remote machine, enter the system IP address or hostname of the Xbox One console.
segment.target: In Remote machine, enter the system IP address or hostname of the Xbox One console.

segment.source: For information about obtaining the IP address or hostname, see Introduction to Xbox One tools.
segment.target: For information about obtaining the IP address or hostname, see Introduction to Xbox One tools.

segment.source: In the Authentication Mode drop-down list, select Universal (Unencrypted Protocol).
segment.target: In the Authentication Mode drop-down list, select Universal (Unencrypted Protocol).

segment.source: C# BlankApp Property Pages
segment.target: C# BlankApp Property Pages

segment.source: Starting a C++ project
segment.target: Starting a C++ project

segment.source: C++ project
segment.target: C++ project

segment.source: Select the default options in the New Universal Windows Project dialog.
segment.target: Select the default options in the New Universal Windows Project dialog.

segment.source: If the Developer Mode dialog appears, click OK.
segment.target: If the Developer Mode dialog appears, click OK.

segment.source: A new blank app is created.
segment.target: A new blank app is created.

segment.source: Configure your development environment for remote debugging:
segment.target: Configure your development environment for remote debugging:

segment.source: Right-click the project, and then select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the project, and then select Properties.

segment.source: On the Debugging tab, change Debugger to launch to Remote Machine.
segment.target: On the Debugging tab, change Debugger to launch to Remote Machine.

segment.source: In Machine Name, enter the system IP address or hostname of the Xbox One console.
segment.target: In Machine Name, enter the system IP address or hostname of the Xbox One console.

segment.source: For information about obtaining the IP address or hostname, see Introduction to Xbox One tools.
segment.target: For information about obtaining the IP address or hostname, see Introduction to Xbox One tools.

segment.source: In the Authentication Type drop-down list, select Universal (Unencrypted Protocol).
segment.target: In the Authentication Type drop-down list, select Universal (Unencrypted Protocol).

segment.source: C++ BlankApp Property Pages
segment.target: C++ BlankApp Property Pages

segment.source: Pin-pair your device with Visual Studio
segment.target: Pin-pair your device with Visual Studio

segment.source: Save your settings, and make sure your Xbox One console is in Developer Mode.
segment.target: Save your settings, and make sure your Xbox One console is in Developer Mode.

segment.source: Press F5.
segment.target: Press F5.

segment.source: If this is your first deployment, you will get a dialog from Visual Studio asking to PIN-pair your device.
segment.target: If this is your first deployment, you will get a dialog from Visual Studio asking to PIN-pair your device.

segment.source: To obtain a PIN, open Dev Home from the Home screen on your Xbox One console.
segment.target: To obtain a PIN, open Dev Home from the Home screen on your Xbox One console.

segment.source: Select Pair with Visual Studio.
segment.target: Select Pair with Visual Studio.

segment.source: Pair with Visual Studio dialog
segment.target: Pair with Visual Studio dialog

segment.source: Enter your PIN into the Pair with Visual Studio dialog.
segment.target: Enter your PIN into the Pair with Visual Studio dialog.

segment.source: The following PIN is just an example; yours will differ.
segment.target: The following PIN is just an example; yours will differ.

segment.source: Pair with Visual Studio PIN dialog
segment.target: Pair with Visual Studio PIN dialog

segment.source: Deployment errors, if any, will appear in the Output window.
segment.target: Deployment errors, if any, will appear in the Output window.

segment.source: Congratulations, you've successfully created and deployed your first UWP app on Xbox!
segment.target: Congratulations, you've successfully created and deployed your first UWP app on Xbox!

segment.target: See also

segment.target: Enabling Developer Mode on Xbox One
